sentence.Network_en: The captain of the submarine has got this periscope thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个潜艇艇长有个类似于潜望镜之类的东西.

sentence.Network_en: The captain aligned the periscope on the bearing.
sentence.Network_cn: 船长使潜望镜对准方位。

sentence.Network_en: Now, peering through the periscope he remarked in businesslike tones.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在, 他一面从潜望镜里观察,一面用精干踏实的口吻说话.

entry.def: A periscope is a vertical tube which people inside submarines can look through to see above the surface of the water.

means.word_mean: 1. an optical instrument that provides a view of an otherwise obstructed field

auth_sentence.content: He played with a periscope on the top of his head; always scanning the pitch.
auth_sentence.res_content: He played with a periscope on the top of his head; always scanning the pitch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He played with a periscope on the top of his head; always scanning the pitch.

auth_sentence.content: Turn the 'far' end of the periscope down so it sticks out to the side away from the other eye, while still looking forward.

stems_affixes.word_buile: peri周围,靠近+patet踏,走+ic→走遍→巡游
peri周围,靠近+phras=phrase词语+tic……的→词语绕圈→冗赘的
peri周围,靠近+gee走→走到周围→近地点
peri周围,靠近+meter测量→测量一圈→周边
peri周围,靠近+pher带有+y→带到周围→外围
peri周围,靠近+scope周围→[潜望镜伸出水面]看周围情况→潜望镜
